alternatives.transcript: in September of 1994 the Department of Labor's occupational safety and health administration OSHA open public hearings on the highly restrictive workplace smoking regulation and proposed in April if implemented the regulation will require all offices hotels restaurants bars and entertainment establishments perhaps even private homes used for business purposes to establish separately enclosed separately ventilated smoking areas where no work can occur because

a few businesses could afford to comply with the rule the result would be a de facto smoking ban in response to its proposal oh sure received over 150,000 letters from individuals organizations business owners and employees the overwhelming majority oppose this measure recently representatives of American businesses both large and small went to Washington to testify at the OSHA hearings and while casinos bowling alleys restaurants and tourist agencies

he seemed to have few similarities in opposing the osher proposed smoking ban they have indeed found Common Ground representatives from each of these industries testified at the hearings to explain the importance of maintaining the right to run their businesses the way they see fit without government regulations on smoking the bowling Proprietors like many small business owners and operators are concerned about increasing levels of government regulation

coming from a variety of government sources at the local state and federal level all evidence suggests that the proposed regulations would have an immediate significant detrimental effect on the economic viability of the bowling industry it is patently unfair the association fields for the federal government to proposed rules that would mandate certain Behavior by the casino industry and then ignore the significant adverse economic impacts of these rules
the reason that I am here to today is myself and our employees are both opposed to this ban on smoking

I feel that it would hurt my business greatly and frankly I don't think the government has a right to tell me what is good for me personally my employees Bill the same way people expressed concern about the government telling them how to run their businesses particularly when OSHA has given so little consideration to the tremendous economic impact of the rule on businesses employees and the

communities in which they exist the owner is cost of compliance with the proposed regulations would diverts cash resources of money and volunteer time from the essential programs of the organization and in a very real sense impoverished the communities of which the American Legion Post is so much apart from my understanding of it to comply with this regulation in fact bars and

restaurants would not be allowed to have any consumption of tobacco products whatsoever we believe strongly that if in fact this regulation is adopted that people will stop coming into our taverns they will in a word stay home enjoyed tobacco products in their home and consume other forms of entertainment in their home if this regulation is adopted our strong belief
our Research indicates you will be essentially putting a noose around our neck

and killing our industry the hospitality industry could stand to lose the most a new study conducted for the National Restaurant Association shows that under the OSHA regulation the restaurant industry will suffer losses of 18 point two billion dollars which could result in tens of thousands of lost jobs were these proposals to be put into effect they would cause some closures there they would cause some decrease in jobs under OSHA has proposed rule can build

separate room maintain it at a negative pressure and exhausted separately to the outside people can go in there to smoke but the restaurant can't sue serve food or drinks bring people are checks remove dirty dishes wipe off tables and counters or in short do any of the things you have to do in a restaurant the rule in a nutshell says you can't smoke where you work or work where you smoke how could you serve smokers under those conditions obviously you couldn't

I literally think it would be devastating to me I think it would probably lose two storage do three million dollars a year this is a live stream of - to open a restaurant bar I'm employing people and I'm paying a lot of taxes and I honestly think this might totally ruined my business another study just released by the San Francisco hotel association shows the negative effects of the proposed smoking ban on the u.s. tourism industry a loss of 3.9 billion dollars in spending

ding by Foreign visitors to the United States and job losses estimated at 62,000 if we want foreign tourists and foreign based businesses to come to the United States let's make some Provisions for them if we don't they do have the rest of the world from which to choose as a travel professional I can promise you that if the proposed OSHA rules are past inbound tourism to the United States will see

supper my experience my gut feeling tells me that this proposal will be a disaster I hope that OSHA and it's officials will look into the human side of his poorly thought-out regulation and realize that the hospitality industry must satisfy all patrons it all its patrons or they'll be out of business and that's the other message from business to OSHA that establishment owners and managers have been and

continue to do whatever they can to ensure Pleasant environments for patrons and employees smokers and non-smokers alike already many have taken steps to fulfill This Promise for example by improving ventilation systems because we're concerned with the comfort of our customers we have installed the try on model CAE 128 system allows both are smoking and non-smoking customers

enjoy a relaxing evening in the same room the bottom line is the casinos are not stuffy Office Buildings with poor ventilation they are spacious facilities with large open areas designed to provide clean and enjoyable environment for both their guests and their employees

we always accommodate with non-smoking or smoking facilities depending on the company's requirements taking into account what's best for each group always offering options and American businesses want to work it out in a way that's fair to everyone in a way that won't cost owners managers and employees their businesses and their jobs
